exam.title: YDS Tam Deneme Sınavı 7
exam.description: 80 soruluk tam boy YDS deneme sınavı - Neuroplasticity, Blockchain, Cultural Relativism, Renewable Energy, Food Security konuları

questions.question_text: The company ---- a new marketing strategy by the time the competitors ---- their campaign.
questions.explanation: Geçmişte birbirini takip eden iki eylemden önce gerçekleşeni 'past perfect' (had developed), sonrakini 'simple past' (launched) ile ifade ederiz. Şirket önce stratejiyi geliştirmiş, rakipler sonra kampanyayı başlatmış.

questions.question_text: Neuroplasticity refers to the brain's ability to ---- and reorganize itself throughout a person's lifetime.
questions.explanation: 'Adapt' (uyum sağlamak) nöroplastisite bağlamında doğru kelimedir. Beynin kendini yeniden organize etme yeteneği adaptasyon gerektirir. Diğer seçenekler olumsuz anlam taşır.

questions.question_text: ---- the technological advancements in recent years, many developing countries still lack access to basic internet services.
questions.explanation: 'Despite' ardından isim grubu gelir ve kontrast ifade eder. 'Although' cümle ile kullanılır. 'Even' tek başına kullanılamaz. 'Because of' ve 'due to' neden-sonuç ilişkisi kurar, kontrast değil.

questions.question_text: The study's findings ---- the hypothesis that sleep deprivation negatively affects cognitive performance.
questions.explanation: 'Confirm' (doğrulamak) bulgular ve hipotez arasında olumlu ilişki kurar. Diğer seçenekler karşı çıkma veya itiraz anlamı taşır.

questions.question_text: The board of directors insisted that the CEO ---- a detailed report on the financial irregularities.
questions.explanation: 'Insist', 'demand', 'require' gibi fiillerden sonra subjunctive mood kullanılır: (that) + subject + base form. Bu nedenle 'submit' doğrudur.

questions.question_text: Blockchain technology has the potential to ---- traditional financial systems by providing more transparent and secure transactions.
questions.explanation: 'Revolutionize' (devrim yaratmak) teknolojinin olumlu etkisini vurgular. 'Undermine' (zayıflatmak) olumsuz anlam taşır. Diğer seçenekler bağlama uygun değil.

questions.question_text: By next year, the research team ---- over 500 participants for their longitudinal study.
questions.explanation: 'By next year' gelecekte bir zamana kadar tamamlanacak eylemi gösterir, bu nedenle 'future perfect' (will have recruited) kullanılır.

questions.question_text: Cultural relativism suggests that moral and ethical standards are ---- to the culture in which they exist.
questions.explanation: 'Specific' (özgü, özel) kültürel görecelik kavramını doğru yansıtır. Evrensel değil, her kültüre özgü standartlar olduğunu ifade eder.

questions.question_text: The experiment ---- more accurately if the researchers ---- better equipment.
questions.option_b: would have been conducted / had had
questions.explanation: Geçmişteki gerçekleşmemiş durumu ifade eden Type 3 conditional: would have + past participle / if + past perfect. Deney yapılmadı çünkü ekipman yoktu.

questions.question_text: The rapid ---- of renewable energy sources is essential for combating climate change.
questions.explanation: 'Adoption' (benimseme, kabul etme) yenilenebilir enerji kaynaklarıyla doğal kollokasyon oluşturur. Diğer seçenekler olumsuz anlam taşır.

questions.question_text: The pharmaceutical company ---- clinical trials for the new drug since 2020.
questions.explanation: 'Since 2020' geçmişte başlayıp hala devam eden eylemi gösterir, bu nedenle 'present perfect continuous' (has been conducting) kullanılır.

questions.question_text: The government's failure to address food insecurity has ---- widespread criticism from international organizations.
questions.explanation: 'Provoke' (kışkırtmak, neden olmak) eleştiri ile doğal kollokasyon oluşturur. Başarısızlık eleştiriye neden olmuş.

questions.question_text: ---- the research methodology was flawed, the conclusions drawn from the study remain questionable.
questions.explanation: 'Now that' (artık, şu anda) neden-sonuç ilişkisi kurar. Metodoloji hatalı olduğu için sonuçlar şüpheli. 'Even though' kontrast, diğerleri uygun değil.

questions.question_text: Neuroscientists have discovered that learning new skills can ---- the formation of new neural pathways in the brain.
questions.explanation: 'Stimulate' (uyarmak, teşvik etmek) yeni nöral yolların oluşumunu destekleme anlamına gelir. Diğer seçenekler engelleyici anlamlar taşır.

questions.question_text: It is crucial that every member of the team ---- the safety protocols before starting the experiment.
questions.explanation: 'It is crucial/essential/important that' yapısından sonra subjunctive mood kullanılır: subject + base form. Bu nedenle 'understand' doğrudur.

questions.question_text: The ---- of blockchain in supply chain management has improved transparency and reduced fraud.
questions.explanation: 'Implementation' (uygulama) teknolojinin kullanıma alınmasını ifade eder. Cümlenin olumlu sonuçları bu seçimi destekler.

questions.question_text: The archaeological findings suggest that the ancient civilization ---- a sophisticated writing system.
questions.explanation: Geçmişteki olasılığı 'may have + past participle' ile ifade ederiz. Bulgular geçmişte yazı sisteminin geliştirilmiş olabileceğini gösteriyor.

questions.question_text: Cultural practices should be evaluated within their own context rather than being judged by ---- standards.
questions.explanation: 'External' (dış, harici) kültürel görecelik bağlamında doğrudur. Kendi kültürünün dışındaki standartlarla değil, kendi bağlamında değerlendirilmeli.

questions.question_text: No sooner ---- the presentation ---- than the audience started asking questions.
questions.explanation: 'No sooner ... than' yapısında 'no sooner' sonrası past perfect (had finished) ve inversion kullanılır. 'No sooner had X happened than Y happened' formatı.

questions.question_text: Solar panels have become increasingly ---- as production costs have decreased over the past decade.
questions.explanation: 'Viable' (uygulanabilir, geçerli) maliyetlerin düşmesiyle birlikte artan uygulanabilirliği ifade eder. Diğer seçenekler olumlu gelişmeyi yansıtmaz.

questions.question_text:
According to recent studies, neuroplasticity allows the brain to compensate for injury and disease by reorganizing its structure and function. This remarkable ability means that even after significant damage, such as a stroke, the brain can form new neural connections to bypass damaged areas. However, the degree of recovery varies greatly among individuals and depends on factors such as age, the severity of the injury, and the timing of rehabilitation efforts.

Which of the following can be inferred from the passage?
questions.option_a: Neuroplasticity guarantees complete recovery from brain injuries
questions.option_b: Younger patients always recover better than older patients
questions.option_c: Early intervention may improve recovery outcomes
questions.option_d: Brain damage is irreversible in most cases
questions.option_e: Neuroplasticity only works for minor injuries
questions.explanation: Pasajda 'timing of rehabilitation efforts' (rehabilitasyon çabalarının zamanlaması) iyileşme derecesini etkileyen faktörlerden biri olarak belirtilmiş. Bu, erken müdahalenin sonuçları iyileştirebileceğini ima eder.

questions.question_text: The research findings ---- that regular exercise can significantly improve cognitive function in elderly adults.
questions.explanation: 'Research findings' (araştırma bulguları) özne olarak aktif çatıda 'indicate' (gösterir) fiilini alır. Pasif çatı (are indicated) bu bağlamda uygun değil.

questions.question_text: Blockchain's ---- nature ensures that once data is recorded, it cannot be altered without detection.
questions.explanation: 'Immutable' (değiştirilemez) blockchain'in temel özelliğidir. Veri kaydedildikten sonra değiştirilemez. 'Mutable' (değiştirilebilir) tam tersi anlam taşır.

questions.question_text: Had the team ---- the data more carefully, they ---- the error before publication.
questions.explanation: Inversion ile Type 3 conditional: Had + subject + past participle / subject + would have + past participle. Geçmişte gerçekleşmemiş durumu ifade eder.

questions.question_text: Anthropologists argue that ethical judgments should be made in relation to the cultural context in which behaviors ----.
questions.explanation: 'Emerge' (ortaya çıkmak) davranışların kültürel bağlamda nasıl geliştiğini ifade eder. Kültürel görecelik bağlamında en uygun seçenek.

questions.question_text: The documentary, ---- was filmed over five years, explores the effects of climate change on polar ecosystems.
questions.explanation: Virgüller arasındaki non-defining relative clause'da 'which' kullanılır. 'That' defining clause'larda ve virgülsüz kullanılır.

questions.question_text: Wind and solar energy are considered ---- resources because they can be replenished naturally.
questions.explanation: 'Renewable' (yenilenebilir) doğal olarak yenilenebilen kaynakları ifade eder. 'Replenished naturally' (doğal olarak yenilenen) bu seçimi destekler.

questions.question_text: Scarcely ---- the meeting started ---- the fire alarm went off.
questions.explanation: 'Scarcely ... when' yapısında 'scarcely' sonrası past perfect (had) ve inversion kullanılır. 'Scarcely had X happened when Y happened' formatı.

questions.question_text: Malnutrition and food insecurity ---- serious challenges to global public health efforts.
questions.explanation: 'Pose' (oluşturmak, ortaya çıkarmak) 'challenge' ile doğal kollokasyon oluşturur. Yetersiz beslenme ve gıda güvensizliği zorluk yaratır.

questions.question_text:
Blockchain technology operates through a decentralized network of computers that validate and record transactions. Each transaction is grouped with others into a 'block' and linked to the previous block, creating a chain of records. The cryptographic nature of this system makes it nearly impossible to alter past transactions without being detected, as any change would require modifying all subsequent blocks across the entire network simultaneously.

What is the main advantage of blockchain mentioned in the passage?
questions.option_a: It eliminates the need for computers
questions.option_d: It reduces the cost of transactions to zero
questions.explanation: Pasajda 'nearly impossible to alter past transactions without being detected' (geçmiş işlemleri fark edilmeden değiştirmek neredeyse imkansız) ifadesi, yetkisiz veri değişikliğini önleme avantajını vurgular.

questions.question_text: The professor recommended that each student ---- their own research topic based on personal interest.
questions.explanation: 'Recommend' fiilinden sonra subjunctive mood kullanılır: (that) + subject + base form. 'Choose' doğru formdur.

questions.question_text: The brain's ---- to learn new languages decreases with age, though adults can still achieve fluency with dedication.
questions.explanation: 'Capacity' (kapasite, yetenek) beynin yeni dil öğrenme yeteneğini ifade eder. Cümlenin ikinci kısmı yeteneğin azaldığını ama var olduğunu gösterir.

questions.question_text: The new vaccine ---- by the end of this year if the clinical trials proceed as planned.
questions.explanation: 'By the end of this year' gelecekte bir zamana kadar tamamlanacak eylemi gösterir, pasif çatıda: will have been + past participle.

questions.question_text: Cultural relativism does not imply moral ---- but rather encourages understanding practices within their cultural framework.
questions.explanation: 'Indifference' (kayıtsızlık) kültürel göreceliliğin yanlış anlaşılan yönüdür. Pasaj bunun olmadığını, anlamayı teşvik ettiğini söylüyor.

questions.question_text: Under no circumstances ---- the laboratory equipment without proper training.
questions.explanation: 'Under no circumstances' gibi olumsuz ifadeler cümle başında inversion gerektirir: modal/auxiliary + subject + verb. 'Should students use' doğru yapıdır.

questions.question_text: The transition to renewable energy requires substantial ---- in infrastructure and technology development.
questions.explanation: 'Investment' (yatırım) altyapı ve teknoloji geliştirme ile doğal kollokasyon oluşturur. Geçiş için yatırım gerekir.

questions.question_text:
Cultural relativism emerged as a response to ethnocentrism, the belief that one's own culture is superior to others. Anthropologists like Franz Boas argued that cultures should be studied on their own terms, recognizing that what seems strange or wrong from an outsider's perspective may be logical and functional within its own cultural context. This approach has been crucial in advancing cross-cultural understanding, though critics argue it can sometimes prevent legitimate criticism of harmful practices.

According to the passage, what is a potential criticism of cultural relativism?
questions.option_b: It was developed by Franz Boas
questions.option_c: It may inhibit criticism of harmful practices
questions.option_d: It makes cultures impossible to study
questions.option_e: It proves all cultures are superior
questions.explanation: Pasajın son cümlesinde 'critics argue it can sometimes prevent legitimate criticism of harmful practices' (eleştirmenler bunun bazen zararlı uygulamaların meşru eleştirisini engelleyebileceğini savunur) ifadesi bu eleştiriyi açıklar.

questions.question_text: It is imperative that the government ---- immediate action to address the housing crisis.
questions.explanation: 'It is imperative/essential/vital that' yapısından sonra subjunctive mood kullanılır: subject + base form. 'Take' doğru formdur.

questions.question_text: Distributed ledger technology ---- the way financial transactions are processed by removing intermediaries.
questions.explanation: 'Transform' (dönüştürmek) aracıların kaldırılmasıyla gelen değişimi ifade eder. Olumlu ve köklü bir değişiklik anlamı taşır.

questions.question_text: The climate conference ---- by representatives from over 190 countries next month.
questions.explanation: Konferans katılım alan taraftır (pasif özne), bu nedenle pasif çatı gerekir: will be attended (katılılacak). Temsilciler konferansa katılır, konferans katılmaz.

questions.question_text: Chronic malnutrition can ---- a child's cognitive development and academic performance.
questions.explanation: 'Impair' (bozmak, zayıflatmak) kronik yetersiz beslenmenin olumsuz etkisini ifade eder. Diğer seçenekler olumlu anlam taşır.

questions.question_text: The theory ---- by Einstein has been validated through numerous experiments over the past century.
questions.explanation: Pasif anlamlı past participle (proposed) sıfat olarak kullanılır: the theory proposed by Einstein (Einstein tarafından öne sürülen teori).

questions.question_text: Neuroplasticity research has ---- the previously held belief that brain structure is fixed after childhood.
questions.explanation: 'Challenge' (meydan okumak, sorgulamak) eski inancın sorgulandığını gösterir. Nöroplastisite araştırması bu inanca karşı çıkar.

questions.question_text:
The global food security crisis is exacerbated by several interconnected factors: climate change reduces crop yields, population growth increases demand, and economic inequality limits access to nutritious food for vulnerable populations. Addressing this crisis requires coordinated international efforts focusing on sustainable agriculture, equitable distribution systems, and climate adaptation strategies. Without such comprehensive action, experts predict that food insecurity will worsen in coming decades.

What does the passage suggest about solving food insecurity?
questions.option_a: It can be solved by focusing only on agricultural production
questions.option_b: It requires addressing multiple factors simultaneously
questions.option_c: It is primarily an economic problem
questions.option_d: It will resolve itself through population control
questions.option_e: It cannot be solved according to experts
questions.explanation: Pasaj 'coordinated international efforts focusing on sustainable agriculture, equitable distribution systems, and climate adaptation strategies' (sürdürülebilir tarım, adil dağıtım sistemleri ve iklim adaptasyon stratejilerine odaklanan koordineli uluslararası çabalar) gerektiğini belirterek çoklu faktörlerin ele alınması gerektiğini vurgular.

questions.question_text: Not only ---- the research provide new insights, but it also opened up possibilities for future studies.
questions.explanation: 'Not only' cümle başında inversion gerektirir. Cümlenin ikinci kısmı past tense (opened) kullandığından 'did' doğrudur: Not only did X happen, but Y also happened.

questions.question_text: Smart contracts on blockchain platforms ---- automatically when predetermined conditions are met.
questions.explanation: 'Execute' (çalıştırmak, uygulamak) akıllı sözleşmelerin otomatik olarak yürütülmesini ifade eder. Blockchain terminolojisinde standart kullanım.

questions.question_text: ---- solar panels nor wind turbines can provide consistent energy without advanced storage solutions.
questions.explanation: 'Neither ... nor' yapısı iki öğeyi de olumsuzlar. 'Neither A nor B' = A da B de değil. Güneş panelleri de rüzgar türbinleri de tek başına tutarlı enerji sağlayamaz.

questions.question_text: Anthropologists use ---- observation to study cultural practices without imposing external judgments.
questions.explanation: 'Participant observation' (katılımcı gözlem) antropolojide kullanılan standart araştırma yöntemidir. Araştırmacı kültüre katılarak gözlem yapar.

questions.question_text: The patients who ---- the new treatment showed remarkable improvement within weeks.
questions.explanation: Ana cümle past tense (showed) kullandığından, defining relative clause'da da past tense (received) kullanılmalıdır. Zaman uyumu gerekir.

questions.question_text: The brain's ability to form new connections diminishes with age but never completely ----.
questions.explanation: 'Disappear' (yok olmak) 'diminishes but never completely' (azalır ama hiçbir zaman tamamen...) ifadesiyle uyumludur. Yetenek azalır ama tamamen yok olmaz.

questions.question_text:
Renewable energy technologies have advanced significantly, yet their widespread adoption faces several obstacles. Initial installation costs remain high, though long-term savings are substantial. Energy storage technology is improving but still cannot fully compensate for the intermittent nature of solar and wind power. Additionally, existing infrastructure is designed for centralized fossil fuel power plants, requiring massive investment to accommodate distributed renewable sources.

What is the main challenge to renewable energy adoption according to the passage?
questions.option_a: Renewable energy is more expensive than fossil fuels
questions.option_e: There is no long-term economic benefit
questions.explanation: Pasaj birden fazla engelden bahseder: yüksek kurulum maliyetleri, depolama teknolojisi sınırlamaları ve altyapı uyumsuzluğu. 'Several obstacles' (birkaç engel) ifadesi bunu özetler.

questions.question_text: The symposium participants demanded that the organizers ---- more time for networking sessions.
questions.explanation: 'Demand' fiilinden sonra subjunctive mood kullanılır: (that) + subject + base form. 'Allocate' doğru formdur.

questions.question_text: Blockchain's decentralized structure eliminates the need for a ---- authority to verify transactions.
questions.explanation: 'Central' (merkezi) blockchain'in merkeziyetsiz yapısıyla kontrast oluşturur. Merkezi otorite gereksinimini ortadan kaldırır.

questions.question_text: Rarely ---- such a comprehensive study on the effects of meditation on brain structure.
questions.explanation: 'Rarely' gibi sıklık zarfları cümle başında inversion gerektirir: have/has + subject + past participle. 'Have researchers conducted' doğru yapıdır.

questions.question_text: Critics of cultural relativism argue that it can lead to moral ---- by refusing to condemn practices that violate human rights.
questions.explanation: 'Moral paralysis' (ahlaki felç) kınama yapmamaktan kaynaklanan hareketsizliği ifade eder. İnsan haklarını ihlal eden uygulamaları kınamayı reddetmek ahlaki felce yol açabilir.

questions.question_text: The research findings suggest that neuroplasticity ---- throughout life, though at varying rates.
questions.explanation: Genel gerçekleri ifade eden bilimsel bulgular için simple present (occurs) kullanılır. 'Throughout life' yaşam boyu devam eden genel bir durumu gösterir.

questions.question_text: Developing countries often lack the ---- to invest in expensive renewable energy infrastructure.
questions.explanation: 'Resources' (kaynaklar) yatırım yapabilme kapasitesini ifade eder. Gelişmekte olan ülkelerin pahalı altyapıya yatırım yapmak için kaynakları yoktur.

questions.question_text:
Smart contracts are self-executing agreements with the terms directly written into code. Unlike traditional contracts that require intermediaries like lawyers or notaries to ensure compliance, smart contracts automatically execute when conditions are met. This automation reduces costs and processing time while increasing transparency and trust. However, the immutability of blockchain means that errors in smart contract code cannot be easily corrected, potentially leading to significant financial losses.

According to the passage, what is a disadvantage of smart contracts?
questions.option_c: Coding errors cannot be easily fixed
questions.explanation: Pasajın son cümlesinde 'errors in smart contract code cannot be easily corrected, potentially leading to significant financial losses' (akıllı sözleşme kodundaki hatalar kolayca düzeltilemez, potansiyel olarak önemli mali kayıplara yol açabilir) ifadesi bu dezavantajı belirtir.

questions.question_text: By 2030, renewable energy sources ---- more than 50% of global electricity production.
questions.explanation: 'By 2030' gelecekteki bir zamanda gerçekleşecek eylemi gösterir, bu nedenle future simple (will account for) kullanılır.

questions.question_text: Adequate nutrition is ---- for proper brain development during childhood and adolescence.
questions.explanation: 'Essential' (gerekli, vazgeçilmez) beyin gelişimi için yeterli beslenmenin önemini vurgular. 'Proper brain development' bunu destekler.

questions.question_text: The manuscript, ---- by the author over a decade, was finally published last year.
questions.explanation: Pasif anlamlı past participle (written) sıfat olarak kullanılır: the manuscript written by the author (yazar tarafından yazılan el yazması).

questions.question_text: The concept of cultural relativism has been both praised for promoting tolerance and ---- for potentially excusing harmful practices.
questions.explanation: 'Criticized' (eleştirilmek) 'both praised ... and criticized' yapısında 'praised' ile kontrast oluşturur. Hem övülmüş hem eleştirilmiş.

questions.question_text: Little ---- about the long-term effects of these new medications on cognitive function.
questions.explanation: 'Little' cümle başında inversion gerektirir: Little + be/auxiliary + subject + main verb. 'Little is known' (çok az şey biliniyor) doğru yapıdır.

questions.question_text: Cryptocurrency transactions are recorded on a public ---- that anyone can access and verify.
questions.explanation: 'Ledger' (defter, kayıt defteri) blockchain ve kripto para bağlamında standart terimdir. 'Public ledger' (halka açık defter) blockchain'in özellığidir.

questions.question_text:
Food insecurity affects not only physical health but also mental well-being and academic achievement. Children experiencing hunger are more likely to suffer from anxiety, depression, and behavioral problems. They also perform worse academically, showing lower test scores and higher rates of grade repetition. These effects can persist into adulthood, creating a cycle of poverty and malnutrition across generations.

What does the passage imply about food insecurity?
questions.option_b: Its effects are limited to childhood
questions.option_c: It can have long-lasting intergenerational consequences
questions.option_e: It can be easily overcome in adulthood
questions.explanation: Pasajın son cümlesinde 'These effects can persist into adulthood, creating a cycle of poverty and malnutrition across generations' (Bu etkiler yetişkinliğe kadar devam edebilir, nesillerden nesillere yoksulluk ve yetersiz beslenme döngüsü yaratır) ifadesi nesiller arası sonuçları vurgular.

questions.question_text: The committee proposed that funding ---- equally among all research departments.
questions.explanation: 'Propose' fiilinden sonra subjunctive mood kullanılır, pasif çatıda: (that) + subject + be + past participle. 'Be distributed' doğrudur.

questions.question_text: Learning a musical instrument can ---- the development of neural pathways associated with memory and coordination.
questions.explanation: 'Facilitate' (kolaylaştırmak) müzik öğrenmenin nöral yolların gelişimini nasıl desteklediğini ifade eder. Diğer seçenekler engelleyici anlamlar taşır.

questions.question_text: ---- the research team completed the data analysis, they submitted their findings to a peer-reviewed journal.
questions.explanation: 'As soon as' (... -ir -maz) hemen peşinden gelen eylemi ifade eder. Veri analizi bitince hemen bulguları gönderdiler.

questions.question_text: Hydroelectric power is considered renewable but faces criticism for its ---- impact on river ecosystems.
questions.explanation: 'Adverse' (olumsuz, zararlı) 'faces criticism' (eleştiri alır) ifadesiyle uyumludur. Hidroelektrik nehir ekosistemleri üzerinde zararlı etkiye sahiptir.

questions.question_text: Should the experiment ---- unexpected results, the researchers will need to revise their hypothesis.
questions.explanation: 'Should' ile başlayan conditional inversion: Should + subject + base form = If + subject + should + base form. 'Should the experiment produce' = 'If the experiment should produce'.

questions.question_text: Anthropologists must remain ---- when studying unfamiliar cultural practices to avoid imposing their own values.
questions.explanation: 'Objective' (objektif, tarafsız) kendi değerlerini dayatmaktan kaçınma gerekliliğiyle uyumludur. Antropologlar tarafsız kalmalı.

questions.question_text:
The brain's neuroplastic capabilities are most pronounced during critical periods of development, but research shows that adults retain significant capacity for neural reorganization. Language learning, musical training, and even physical exercise can induce structural changes in the adult brain. These findings have important implications for rehabilitation after brain injury and for maintaining cognitive function in aging populations.

What is the main point of the passage?
questions.option_a: Only children's brains can change structurally
questions.option_c: Language learning is the best way to change the brain
questions.option_d: Brain injury cannot be rehabilitated in adults
questions.explanation: Pasajın ana fikri 'adults retain significant capacity for neural reorganization' (yetişkinler önemli nöral yeniden organize olma kapasitesini korur) ifadesiyle verilir. Yetişkin beyinleri önemli plastisite gösterir.

questions.question_text: The regulations require that all participants ---- informed consent before enrolling in the study.
questions.explanation: 'Require' fiilinden sonra subjunctive mood kullanılır: (that) + subject + base form. 'Provide' doğru formdur.

questions.question_text: Blockchain technology enables ---- transactions without the need for trusted third parties.
questions.explanation: 'Peer-to-peer' (eşten eşe) güvenilir üçüncü taraflara gerek olmadan doğrudan işlemleri ifade eder. Blockchain'in temel özelliğidir.

questions.question_text: Only when we understand the cultural context ---- properly interpret social behaviors.
questions.explanation: 'Only when' cümle başında inversion gerektirir: Only when + clause + auxiliary + subject + verb. 'Can we' doğru yapıdır.

questions.question_text: International organizations are working to ---- global food distribution systems to ensure equitable access to nutrition.
questions.explanation: 'Improve' (iyileştirmek) adil beslenme erişimini sağlama amacıyla uyumludur. Diğer seçenekler olumsuz veya amaçla çelişir.

questions.question_text: The solar farm, ---- construction was completed last month, will generate enough electricity for 10,000 homes.
questions.explanation: 'Whose' iyelik gösteren relative pronoun olarak kullanılır: whose construction = its construction (onun inşaatı). Güneş çiftliğinin inşaatı.

questions.question_text: The study aims to ---- whether meditation can enhance neuroplasticity in older adults.
questions.explanation: 'Determine' (belirlemek) araştırmanın amacını ifade eder. Çalışma meditasyonun nöroplastisiteyi artırıp artırmadığını belirlemeyi amaçlar.

questions.question_text: Were the government ---- more funding to renewable energy research, significant breakthroughs could be achieved.
questions.explanation: 'Were' ile başlayan conditional inversion: Were + subject + to + base form = If + subject + were to + base form. Type 2 conditional yapısı.

questions.question_text:
Critics argue that pure cultural relativism creates a logical paradox: if we must respect all cultural values equally, including those that reject tolerance and relativism itself, we undermine the very foundation of the relativist position. This philosophical challenge has led many scholars to advocate for a modified form of relativism that acknowledges universal human rights while still recognizing cultural diversity.

What problem with pure cultural relativism does the passage identify?
questions.option_a: It requires too much cultural knowledge
questions.explanation: Pasaj 'creates a logical paradox' (mantıksal bir paradoks yaratır) ifadesiyle, tüm değerlere eşit saygı göstermenin göreceliği inkâr eden değerlere de saygı göstermeyi gerektirdiğini ve bunun kendi temelini zayıflattığını belirtir. Bu kendisiyle çelişen bir durumdur.
